main event: An observer reported seeing a steady light overhead that traveled almost due North and disappeared just above the horizon in Newark, Ohio on August 23, 1962.
interesting points: The light did not change in brightness during the sighting.
The Air Force sent a questionnaire to the observer but did not receive a reply, suggesting it may have been a high-flying aircraft.
The report notes 'insufficient data for analysis' and that the 'GSA lota 2 decayed this report'.
The Air Force requested further information from the observer in a letter dated 1970, several years after the original sighting.
